div.p: In order to in situ observe the formation of ternary compounds Mg-B-C under high pressures and high temperatures, the mixture of Mg, glassy carbon and amorphous boron has been compressed to 9 GPa and probed by X-ray diffraction (XRD) during heating.

The sequence of XRD patterns has been obtained at ID06 beamline of ESRF using newly installed large-volume press allowing to probe the large enough amount (1-3 mm 3 ) of light-element samples to obtain a good quality powder diffraction paterns under pressures. Pressure and temperature have been estimated using the p-V-T equations of state of Mg and MgO.

The onset of formation of new phases was observed at ~1500 K, similar to the case of Mg-C mixture alone. However, the final product of crystallization was completely different. 0 100 200 300 0.000 0.004 0.008 Magnetization-DC (Oe) Temperature (K)

figure.figDesc: Figure shows a diffraction pattern of thus grown single crystal of a new ternary compound. The preliminary analysis of spot positions allowed us to establish the hexagonal symmetry, lattice parameters (a = 6.456 A, c = 5.229 A) and the most probable space groups (P6 3 /mmc, P6 3 /mcm, and P6 3 mc). Possible isostructural compounds are Ni 3 S 4 , FeS(2H), Mn 5 Si 3 , and ZnCl 3 . Preliminary magnetic measurements show the ferromagnetic properties with T Curie > 300 K (Inset ot the Figure). Further studies of new compound are on the way.
